title: Classic Pickled Eggs Recipe
description: These pickled eggs, made with hard-boiled eggs in a sweet and tangy vinegar brine flavored with salt, sugar, and garlic, are a tasty snack.
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Appetizers and Snacks Pickled Egg Recipes Classic Pickled Eggs 4.8 (39) 37 Reviews 18 Photos These pickled eggs make a tasty savory snack or delicious addition to salads, or sandwiches! The hard-boiled eggs are pickled in a vinegar brine that's simple to make with vinegar, sugar, salt, and a few cloves of garlic. Submitted by Rod Updated on April 14, 2025 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 18 18 18 18 Prep Time: 10 mins Cook Time: 20 mins Additional Time: 7 days Total Time: 7 days 30 mins Servings: 12 Yield: 12 pickled eggs Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 12 servings 12 small eggs 3 cups white vinegar ¼ cup white sugar 1 tablespoon salt 2 cloves garlic 1 bay leaf Directions Gather all ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Place eggs in a saucepan and cover with water. Bring to a boil, remove from heat, and let eggs stand in hot water for 15 minutes. Remove eggs from hot water, cool under cold running water, and peel. Discard hot water. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Bring vinegar, sugar, and salt to a boil in the same saucepan until sugar is dissolved. Remove from heat. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Place peeled eggs, garlic, and bay leaf in a 1-quart mason jar; top with vinegar mixture. Seal the jar and refrigerate for at least 1 week before serving. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Recipe Tip You can add slices of jalapeño pepper to the jar for a little extra zing! Editor's Note: The nutrition data for this recipe includes the full amount of the pickling solution ingredients. The actual amount of pickling solution consumed will vary. I Made It Print 213 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 71 Calories 4g Fat 5g Carbs 5g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 12 Calories 71 % Daily Value * Total Fat 4g 5% Saturated Fat 1g 6% Cholesterol 138mg 46% Sodium 633mg 28% Total Carbohydrate 5g 2% Total Sugars 5g Protein 5g 9% Vitamin C 0mg 0% Calcium 21mg 2% Iron 1mg 4% Potassium 52mg 1% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Classic Pickled Eggs 01 of 18 Photo by  Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 18 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02/16/2025 A keeper! Great flavors Easy to follow Worth the effort Family favorite We like pickles but pickled eggs disappear the moment we place the jar on the counter top, our grown up kids and their families descend upon the jar like nothing else! Easy to make and a healthy snack for all. Just make sure the eggs are fully cooked with no soft yokes otherwise they will spoil ! Add chilli pepper or a slice of white onion or just do it plain… 03 of 18 Photo by  OldBoard7630 06/03/2023 I have used this recipe multiple times. It is always my go to and everyone that has tried them absolutely loves them. I usually add some jalapeños and peppercorns but this time have also added red pepper flakes and tried smoking the eggs instead of boiling. 04 of 18 Photo by  blucie6717 05/24/2022 This recipe is easy, and you get a tasty batch of pickled eggs every time. Today, I put thinly sliced red onion and peppercorns into the jar, and it makes an attractive presentation. In the past, I have used fresh tarragon instead of bay leaf. It gives a deliciously delicate tarragon flavor to the eggs. 05 of 18 Photo by  LeahG 07/02/2021 06 of 18 Photo by  Holly 05/14/2020 07 of 18 Photo by  eileenm 02/03/2020 08 of 18 Photo by  Jeff Contonio 03/03/2019 Great recipe! I like it spicy so I like to add a couple yellow Trinidad Moruga Scorpion peppers. I usually make 2 dozen at a time. The wait is the hardest part. 09 of 18 Photo by  Lee Sapara 09/18/2018 10 of 18 Photo by  Christopher Negron 07/23/2018 1 2 Next You’ll Also Love Emily's Pickled Eggs 124 Ratings Pickled Red Beet Eggs 158 Ratings Pickled Eggs 52 Ratings Easy Pickled Eggs 10 Ratings Popa's Pickled Eggs 57 Ratings Pickle Brine Pickled Eggs Garlic Pickled Eggs 52 Ratings Pickled Eggs with Beet Juice 16 Ratings Balsamic-Pickled Eggs 28 Ratings Mustard Pickled Eggs 37 Ratings Pickled Eggs III 6 Ratings Pickled Eggs II 91 Ratings Sweet Pickled Eggs 41 Ratings Quick Pickled Eggs and Beets 223 Ratings Yellow Pickled Eggs 25 Ratings Ramen Eggs (Ajitsuke Tamago) 1 Rating Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family.
